thread.title: Michael Klinger named in Australian T20 squad to face Sri Lanka
thread.title_full: Michael Klinger named in Australian T20 squad to face Sri Lanka

title: Michael Klinger named in Australian T20 squad to face Sri Lanka

organizations.name: inter milan play video trent sainsbury

text:
Michael Klinger named in Australian T20 squad to face Sri Lanka 43 reading now twitter TWEET More 
Michael Klinger is in line for an international debut in Twenty20 cricket, after being selected in Australia's 13-man squad to face Sri Lanka this month. 
Master blaster Chris Lynn has also been named in Australia's squad for the series, despite still recovering from a neck injury. Mignolet saves penalty as Chelsea draw at Liverpool Play Video Plays of the Week Plays of the Week 
Big alley-oops, tennis fairytales and some epic finishes slide in for this week's biggest plays from the sporting world. Up Next Mignolet saves penalty as Chelsea draw at Liverpool Play Video Mignolet saves penalty as Chelsea draw at ... Mignolet saves penalty as Chelsea draw at Liverpool 
A late penalty save by Liverpool keeper Simon Mignolet held EPL leaders Chelsea to a 1-1 draw at Anfield. Up Next Barba makes shock switch to rugby Play Video Barba makes shock switch to rugby Barba makes shock switch to rugby 
NRL star Ben Barba has signed a deal with French rugby powerhouse Toulon until the end of the season. Vision courtesy Seven Network . Up Next Trent Sainsbury joins Inter Milan Play Video Trent Sainsbury joins Inter Milan Trent Sainsbury joins Inter Milan 
Socceroos defender Trent Sainsbury has completed a dream move from the Chinese Super League to Italian giants Inter Milan until the end of the 2016/17 season. Up Next Australia fall short despite incredible 146 run Stoinis comeback Play Video Australia fall short despite incredible ... Australia fall short despite incredible 146 run Stoinis comeback 
After a horrible collapse by Australia an amazing century from Marcus Stoinis set up a dramatic finish at Eden Park. Up Next Federer wins 18th Grand Slam title Play Video Federer wins 18th Grand Slam title 
Roger Federer has defeated Rafael Nadal in a five set thriller to claim his fifth Australian Open. Up Next Reds & Phoenix sizzle in extreme temperatures Play Video Reds & Phoenix sizzle in extreme ... Reds & Phoenix sizzle in extreme temperatures 
Adelaide United and Wellington Phoenix had to settle for a share of the points after a 2-2 draw on an afternoon where temperatures nudged 40 degrees at Coopers Stadium. More videos Plays of the Week 
Big alley-oops, tennis fairytales and some epic finishes slide in for this week's biggest plays from the sporting world. 
With Australia's Test side preparing for the series in India, veteran Klinger is joined in the squad by fellow potential debutants Billy Stanlake, Jyhe Richardson and Ashton Turner. 
Lynn has been included in the 13-man squad but will face further fitness tests ahead of the three-match series starting February 17 in Melbourne. SHARE National call-up: Michael Klinger. Photo: Getty Images 
Wicketkeeper Tim Paine also returns to the international set-up as Australia look to improve their current T20 ranking of sixth in the world. 
Aaron Finch will captain the side. Advertisement 
"With a number of our frontline players preparing for the India Test series, we have chosen a squad with a good blend of experience combined with several younger players in an effort to improve our performance," chairman of selectors Trevor Hohns said in a statement on Wednesday. 
"The influence of younger players in this squad also gives us the opportunity to look forward to the ICC World T20, which is being hosted here in Australia in 2020. 
"The overall standards being set in the BBL are very high and many of these players are making a good impression, but consistency was key for the selectors on this occasion." 
Hohns said the selection of 36-year-old Klinger was just reward for his performances. 
"He has been a very good player in this form of the game for some time now," Hohns said. 
"He has a history of strong performances in T20 competitions in the UK and in the BBL, including the match-winning innings for the Perth Scorchers to secure this year's BBL title." 
Hohns said Lynn would visit a specialist later this week, with the outcome to determine his part in the series. 
Australia meet the Sri Lankans in Melbourne on February 17, in Geelong on February 19 and in Adelaide on February 22. 
Australian squad: Aaron Finch (capt), Patrick Cummins, James Faulkner, Travis Head, Moises Henriques, Michael Klinger, Chris Lynn, Tim Paine, Jhye Richardson, Billy Stanlake, Ashton Turner, Andrew Tye, Adam Zampa. 
AAP
